org.eclipse.jface.examples.databinding.mask
Class EditMask

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.jface.examples.databinding.mask.EditMask

public class EditMask
extends java.lang.Object

Ensures text widget has the format specified by the edit mask. Edit masks are currently defined as follows: The following characters are reserved words that match specific kinds of characters: # - digits 0-9 A - uppercase A-Z a - upper or lowercase a-z, A-Z n - alphanumeric 0-9, a-z, A-Z All other characters are literals. The above characters may be turned into literals by preceeding them with a backslash. Use two backslashes to denote a backslash. Examples: (###) ###-#### U.S. phone number ###-##-#### U.S. Social Security number \\\### A literal backslash followed by a literal pound symbol followed by two digits Ideas for future expansion: Quantifiers as postfix modifiers to a token. ie: #{1, 2}/#{1,2}/#### MM/DD/YYYY date format allowing 1 or 2 digit month or day Literals may only be quantified as {0,1} which means that they only appear if placeholders on both sides of the literal have data. This will be used along with: Right-to-left support for numeric entry. When digits are being entered and a decimal point is present in the mask, digits to the left of the decimal are entered right-to-left but digits to the right of the decimal left-to-right. This might need to be a separate type of edit mask. (NumericMask, maybe?) Example: $#{0,3},{0,1}#{0,3}.#{0,2} ie: $123,456.12 or $12.12 or $1,234.12 or $123.12 Here's the basic idea of how the current implementation works (the actual implementation is slightly more abstracted and complicated than this): We always let the verify event pass if the user typed a new character or selected/deleted anything. During the verify event, we post an async runnable. Inside that async runnable, we: - Remember the selection position - getText(), then - Strip out all literal characters from text - Truncate the resulting string to raw length of edit mask without literals - Insert literal characters back in the correct positions - setText() the resulting string - reset the selection to the correct location

Since:
3.3

isComplete

public boolean isComplete()
Returns:
true if the field is complete according to the mask; false otherwise

getPlaceholder

public char getPlaceholder()
Returns the placeholder character. The placeholder character must be a different character than any character that is allowed as input anywhere in the edit mask. For example, if the edit mask permits spaces to be used as input anywhere, the placeholder character must be something other than a space character.

The space character is the default placeholder character.

Returns:
the placeholder character

setPlaceholder

public void setPlaceholder(char placeholder)
Sets the placeholder character for the edit mask. The placeholder character must be a different character than any character that is allowed as input anywhere in the edit mask. For example, if the edit mask permits spaces to be used as input anywhere, the placeholder character must be something other than a space character.

The space character is the default placeholder character.

Parameters:
placeholder - The character to use as a placeholder

isFireChangeOnKeystroke

public boolean isFireChangeOnKeystroke()
Indicates if change notifications will be fired after every keystroke that affects the value of the rawText or only when the value is either complete or empty.

Returns:
true if every change (including changes from one invalid state to another) triggers a change event; false if only empty or valid values trigger a change event. Defaults to false.

setFireChangeOnKeystroke

public void setFireChangeOnKeystroke(boolean fireChangeOnKeystroke)
Sets if change notifications will be fired after every keystroke that affects the value of the rawText or only when the value is either complete or empty.

Parameters:
fireChangeOnKeystroke - true if every change (including changes from one invalid state to another) triggers a change event; false if only empty or valid values trigger a change event. Defaults to false.
